Threat Description: The loss of Head of Operations either from long term sickness or leaving.
Risk Description: Knowledge gap from their accumulation of client & process knowledge.
Existing Controls: Some knowledge exists with the CSM but skill set means incumbent CSM is not part of existing succession plan.
Potential Additional Controls: Look to recruit future deputy and train up or widen out internal skill base within the business.

Threat Description: No succession planning in place for Operational Team
Risk Description: Ability to recruit in time and the notice period of any key personnel could mean we have a short / medium term knowledge gap in the business
Existing Controls: Whilst no formal controls are in place knowledge is spread between numerous internal parties including admin, tech, product and ops.
Potential Additional Controls: Consider what high risk duties key personnel do and endeavour to create a back up plan to mitigate any risks.

Threat Description: Incorrect invoicing or account billing or missing invoicing opportunities.
Risk Description: CSM not aware or cognicsent of all billable product features and as a result misses fee earning opportunities.  Or fails to chase clients in a timely manner.
Existing Controls: Real and present risk with incumbent CSM whereby the TSM or the Directors Executive either corrects or reminds CSM to invoice correctly or to bill clients.
Potential Additional Controls: Move this key function out of this role or recruit replacement.

Threat Description: Lack of Cross Departmental Training / Knowledge  (Transfer of Knowledge)
Risk Description: TSM / DE have accumulated long term knowledge of the business and their loss could open us up to gaps in our day to day duties or customer knowledge
Existing Controls: Look to up skill key members of the business so these gaps are mitigated.
Potential Additional Controls: Skill / Knowledge gap analysis then put in place training plans.

Risk Description: Using customer service tools and making changes to products/ services which could adversely impact both financial / reputation of the business
Existing Controls: Basic training is in place.  Ensure key features which could be harmful to our clients our returns are locked out and are only available as view only.
Potential Additional Controls: Ensure training on all key areas to all non technical team members.

Threat Description: Presenting incorrect financial data to a client.
Risk Description: Not being aware products or services or pricing has changed and presenting the incorrect fees to a customer.
Existing Controls: We should only have one place to find all key financial information this should be on sharepoint
Potential Additional Controls: Review all accounts past and present and ensure all Ts & Cs are in place all financial documents can be found and are stored correctly.

Risk Description: All non technical personnel understand the importance of our ISO Audits and their potential involvement
Existing Controls: CISO has control over auditor conversations but not who they choose.   Cascade information of audit should be prescriptive with all team members knowing their potential duties.
Potential Additional Controls: Future training in advancement of audits that you might be called upon.

Existing Controls: Annual PCI Audit requires CTO / CISO to step out the business to perform this annual task.  No succession plan in place.

Risk Description: Mitigate the reliance of contractors in critical roles.
Existing Controls: Upskill existing team members or recruit FTE with a view to replace should need be required

Threat Description: Low fluency in key roles and the ability to use JIRA Atlassian to a good level.
Risk Description: Lack of cross departmental use & knowledge in JIRA and Atlassian could lead to comms gaps
Existing Controls: Still remains a low fluency in Atlassian and Jira between Ops and Product teams which does not aid commercial & engineering fluency

Threat Description: Discipline on file notes customer information .
Risk Description: Multiple locations to update client / customer contact
Existing Controls: Sharepoint; Jira & Monday all store different sources of information.
Potential Additional Controls: Investment in building and training people to use one customer portal [Sharepoint / Jira  etc ]

Threat Description: Fundamental Payment knowledge on pricing and compliance.
Risk Description: Reliant on MD on transactional payment pricing and the generation of margin through payment
Existing Controls: Succession planning required but the use of the Adyen Marketplace Platform will mitigate some of these problems

Threat Description: Not being able to deliver embedded finance products at pace to our chosen markets.
Risk Description: Lack of engineering and product resources to research, design and deliver to market at pace.   Or keep up with the pace of change.
Existing Controls: We are reliant on a small team of engineers & product specialists where we have to design, build and maintain products.

Risk Description: Should we want to be a consumer card issuer.  Greater demands on legal requirements.
Existing Controls: We have limited internal experience of running a consumer card proposition with the existing legal requirements.  Recruitment and will be a requirement.

Threat Description: Lack of capability or capacity to run a Program Office or to manage multiple change streams all at once.
Risk Description: Lack of experience in running an independent PM Office which reports to the executive team.
Existing Controls: Demonstrating we are in control of any significant change programs will require some investment in a PO / PM to independently report to the Exec Board and Investors.

Threat Description: Retention of talent or ensuring those in critical roles are retained or are part of a wider succession plan.  ( Succession Planning / Retention )
Risk Description: 6 monthly review of those in such roles and likelihood to meet succession plans & / or are they a threat to the business by leaving.  Should span all areas.
Existing Controls: Retention plans are co-ordinated with a clear roadmap to support teams to retain their staff.

Threat Description: Regular engagement to manage changes in client behaviour and their business
Risk Description: Transparent risk assessment as to the state of each customer.  Ie Growth / Dormant / Transitioning.
Existing Controls: Regular meetings F2F and virtual to continually assess state of clients.

Threat Description: Over reliance on customer administrators as our core contacts.
Risk Description: Over reliance on 1 or 2 key people in each business and we dont always have  multiple touch points with key organisations.
Existing Controls: We continue to educate and guide our clients in the need to have regular meetings and client reviews.

Threat Description: Low value accounts take up high volumes of administrative time and the returns for growth or profit are low.
Risk Description: Small EV based accounts are labour intensive to service and are not yielding positive returns
Existing Controls: Building bespoke products which can not be reused are timely & expensive and require regular maintenance to manage.  This requires continual engineering support and investment which outweighs the original payment and ongoing earnings.
Potential Additional Controls: Objective assessment over our complete operating model with our future state in mind.
